newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia late rubber steady on short-covering.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia late rubber steady on short-covering.

text.p: Indonesian tyre-grade SIR20 offer prices were steady in slow late trading on Thursday on short-covering, dealers said.
Dealers said February/March SIR20 offer prices were at 55.25-55.75 U.S. cents/lb fob Medan, 55.00-55.25 fob Surabaya, Padang and Palembang and at 54.50-55.00 fob Pontianak and Jambi.

"Singaporean firms bought on Tuesday February SIR20 at 55.00 fob Palembang and Surabaya, but the quantity was generally small as the purchases were only for short-covering," one Jakarta-based dealer said.
Another dealer said there were fresh bids at 54.85 cents/lb for February SIR20 fob Surabaya, but no deals were done.
Dealers said the market was quiet, with no fresh enquiries heard from Singapore as the country's rubber market was closed today due to general election.
